result.execSummary:
The defendant George Arlie Hayes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Letter to Court from George A. Hayes

ADDRESS INFO for George Arlie Hayes
Current: W6173 Bluffview Dr, Montello, WI 53949 United States  (Effective: 12-30-2016)
Prior: 130 Deer Path, Wi Dells, WI 53913
Supplement to Disposition (Restitution)

Defendant George Arlie Hayes in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant George Arlie Hayes in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16CF22, 16CF29 & 16CF70 tracking together:
  Atty Hendee moves to amend Ct. 1 in 16CF22 to Misd. Bail Jumping 946.49(1)(a).    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to the amended Ct. 1 and Ct. 2 in 16CF22 and Ct. 1 in 16CF70.  All other counts along with 16CF29 to be dismissed.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of the amended Ct. 1 and Ct. 2 in 16CF22 and Ct. 1 in 16CF70.  All other counts along with 16CF29 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee states that there are 3 other matters, 16TR1664, 16TR1665 & 16FO147.  Atty Hendee moves to dismiss 16FO147.  Atty Hendee states agreement for 16TR1665, OWI -1st offense.
Defendant enters a No Contest plea to that charge.
BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of OWI - 1st offense.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.  Atty Hendee states that the defendant has warrants in Dane and Monroe County.
BY THE COURT:  Warrants in 16TR1664 & 16TR1665 are quashed.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  16CF22:  Amended Ct. 1 & Ct. 2:  Withhold Sentence; 2 years Probation with conditions:
*Court Costs = 243.00 on each count
*DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge on each count
*AODA and any follow-up treament
*Comply with any and all counseling or treatment recommended by the Agent
*Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance
*Restitution = $229.99 + $22.99 surcharge = $252.98 (to be paid during the time of probation)


16CF70:  Ct. 1:  Withhold Sentence; 3 years Probation with conditions:
*Court Costs = 268.00
*DNA Sample + $250.00 Surcharge 
*AODA and any follow-up treament
*Comply with any and all counseling or treatment recommended by the Agent
*Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance
  If after 3 years the defendant has paid the fine and costs in full, has had no criminal violations & successfully completes Probation, the defendant may petition the court for Expungement 973.015.
  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.

16TR1665:  Pay forfieture of $761.50
*6 months DL Revocation
*AODA and any follow-up treatment
*Blood Draw Reimbursement = $75.00

Credit if revoked will be determined by counsel at a later date.

16CF29 is dismissed.
Counts 2 & 3 to be dismissed in 16CF70
16FO147 to be dismissed.
16TR1664 to be dismissed.

Court orders all cash bonds to be returned to the party that posted it if not done so already.

Defendant George Arlie Hayes in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant George Arlie Hayes in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16CF22 & 16CF29 tracking along with 16CF70:
  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Gumz; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today on 16CF70.  Atty Gumz agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.    Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

Atty Gumz asks that the cash bail be modified to a $250 cash bail on each case; makes arguments and is also looking into possible treatment court.  
Atty Hendee responds and argues the bail modification request.
Atty Gumz makes arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Motion to modify the bond is denied.
Set for Return  Return date scheduled for January 18, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
in Support of Defendant's Motion for Modification of Bail
for Modification of Cash Bail

Defendant George Arlie Hayes in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16CF22 & 16CF29 tracking along with 16CF70:
Atty Hendee requests a $2,500 cash bond on each of the three cases.
Atty Gumz responds.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $1,500 cash bond on each of the three cases, 16CF22, 16CF29 & 16CF70.
Set for Returns to track with 16CF70  Return date scheduled for December 7, 2016 at 10:00 am.

16CF22 & 16CF29 tracking together:
Ms. Hayes requests both cash bonds back for both cases.  Atty Hendee requests a warrant based on the request to return the bond money.  Atty Gumz asks that this be set to the next court date as he is unsure that his client got notice.

BY THE COURT:  Warrant authorized; stay until Monday, October 10th by 4:30pm to give Atty Gumz time to contact the court.  Cash bond in both cases is to be returned to Ms. Hayes after the stay of the Warrant.

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16CF22 & 16CF29 tracking:

BY THE COURT:  Court will hear the motion on August 4th Return Date due to him getting a notice in court for that hearing.
Ms. Hayes will be allowed to appear by telephone for that hearing.
